page.title: 05HOUSING AND POPULATION - 2
page.content:
{ }Before coming to Dyce they had lived either elsewhere in Aberdeen (e.g. Torry, Mannofield, Bucksburn) or as far afield as Turriff, Elgin, Stoke-on-Trent or even Wales.
There are{2954}houses in Dyce, 1541 of which are council houses. The council have sold 206 houses to tenants in the last five years. The prices of which have ranged from {Â£19000 - Â£38500.}In other parts of Dyce the price of houses is much higher. The price of an average private house is between{Â£45000 - {Â£60000.
